text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer lists several concrete contractual levers the author can negotiate regarding pricing and related terms. Specifically, it mentions: 1. Negotiating the exact retail price or formula (Art. L.132-6 CPI). 2. Negotiating a veto right on price changes post-publication. 3. Negotiating royalty base and rate (e.g., 15-25% standard, pushing higher, tiered royalties). 4. Negotiating advances. 5. Negotiating sales reporting/auditing rights (implied via demanding sales reporting). 6. Negotiating reversion rights based on performance thresholds. This clearly exceeds the minimum requirement of three concrete levers.", "criterion_id": "f3a73fbc-9aee-4a68-b68d-4a8cf0c429fd"}
